body_html:
It is expected that the last column is dropped. The same happens with convolution. But we have added a parameter to max pooling and average pooling to take the last column into account as I mentioned before.
Looking at the implementation in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/THNN/generic/SpatialDilatedMaxPooling.c#L50 , there seems to be am extra -1 that is not in your equation. I haven't checked the doc to compare though

It is expected that the last column is dropped. The same happens with convolution. But we have added a parameter to max pooling and average pooling to take the last column into account as I mentioned before.
Looking at the implementation in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/THNN/generic/SpatialDilatedMaxPooling.c#L50 , there seems to be am extra -1 that is not in your equation. I haven't checked the doc to compare though
body:
It is expected that the last column is dropped. The same happens with convolution. But we have added a parameter to max pooling and average pooling to take the last column into account as I mentioned before.
Looking at the implementation in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/THNN/generic/SpatialDilatedMaxPooling.c#L50 , there seems to be am extra -1 that is not in your equation. I haven't checked the doc to compare though
